channel.title: Digging problem[delta]
channel.description:
Well when i try to dig it does the emote. But the emote won't stop so it keeps doing the emote. How can i make it that i only do the emote once?
Vid: [url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8scUnSEC8K8]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8scUnSEC8K8[/url]
thanks, halflive9

item.title: Digging problem[delta]
item.dc:creator: @Zoft1 Zoft™
item.description:
@Zoft1 wrote:

Use Pemote, not start/set animation.

Read full topic

item.title: Digging problem[delta]
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

[quote=“Mental Piracy, post:10, topic:392798”][quote author=halflive9 link=topic=489965.msg3584903#msg3584903 date=1304097388]

I’m using setanimation is how you my code.

case 952: c.setAnimation(831); break;

maybe it was the other way around, post your setamination method, and see if you have a startanimation method, then post it too.

public void setAnimation(int i) { if(deathStage != 0){ return; } startAnimation(i); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

i don’t have startanimation method.
[/quote]
you do have a start animation method… seeing as its showing “startAnimation(i)”.[/quote]

Can’t find it anywhere.

Read full topic

maybe it was the other way around, post your setamination method, and see if you have a startanimation method, then post it too.
[/quote]

public void setAnimation(int i) { if(deathStage != 0){ return; } startAnimation(i); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

i don’t have startanimation method.[/quote]
you do have a start animation method… seeing as its showing “startAnimation(i)”.

item.title: Digging problem[delta]
item.dc:creator: @Mental_Piracy Mental Piracy
item.description:
@Mental_Piracy wrote:

[quote=“halflive9, post:5, topic:392798”][quote author=MrMud link=topic=489965.msg3582636#msg3582636 date=1303917391]
i had the same problem, there should be a weird emote like 99x2(in potion.java) or something chanche this to 831
[/quote]

That’s what i did and it keeps digging… :([/quote]
startAnimation != setAnimation or setAnim. setAnim cycles the emote once, startAnim loops it.

Read full topic
